Question
========
What is the derivative of $f(x) = e^{5x}$?
  
Answerlist
----------
* $e^{5x}$
* $5 e^{5x}$
* $10 e^{5x}$
* $-5 e^{5x}$
* $\frac{e^{5x}}{5}$
* It has no derivative
  
Solution
========
  
Answerlist
----------
* False. You should derive the exponent.
* True. 
* False. The derivative of the exponent is $5$ not $10$. 
* False. The derivative of the exponent is $5$ not $-5$.
* False. The derivative of the exponent is $5$ not $\frac{1}{5}$.   
* False. Its derivative is $5 e^{5x}$
